roleset.name: movement (literally or as in an increase of a specific phenomenon)

example.name: Another example with arg 1
example.text: its first wave of sales of big, sick thrifts
example.arg: of sales of big , sick thrifts

example.name: Example with temporal
example.text: This current wave of anti-Syrian attitudes

roleset.note: No corresponding Verbnet class. Framenet class quantity. Framed by Katie

roleset.name: Cause waving movement

role.descr: entity, person waved at or to

example.name: Wave of hand
example.text: With a wave of his hand , Peng Dehuai said that despite being over 100 regiments , let 's call this campaign the Hundred Regiments Offensive .

example.name: With arg2
example.text: With a wave to my new friend, I walked away, map in hand

roleset.note: Framed by Katie, reframed by Claire, comparison to verb-agitate.01. Roleset based on usages in 00060.

roleset.name: Natural Disaster: tidal wave

role.descr: water surging (might be the name of the ocean, etc)
period length of the wave (usually ft or m)
run-up (height above sea level reached by the water)

example.name: arg2
example.text: 30 Foot Tidal Wave At Reunion Island Came From South African Storm

example.name: arg5
example.text: A submarine impact can produce a megatsunami wave with a run-up in the hundreds of meters, depositing oceanic sediment and impact ejecta (terrestrial material recognizably altered by the pressure and heat of an impact; impact debris) kilometers from the impact site (Bryant 2001; Crawford and Mader 1998). I
example.arg: with a run-up in the hundreds of meters

roleset.note: Added by Julia in a Natural Disaster roleset endeavor. Comparison to 'tsunami'.
